briefTitle: Voltaren Emulgel 2% Acute Ankle Sprain Non Inferiority Study
officialTitle: A Randomized, Double Blind, Multi Center, Active-controlled, 2 Treatment Arm, Parallel Group Non Inferiority Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Diclofenac Diethylamine 2.32% Gel Versus 1.16% Gel in Subjects With Acute Ankle Sprain
summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of diclofenac diethylamine 2.32 percent (%) gel applied twice daily versus diclofenac diethylamine 1.16% gel applied four times daily for 7 days in participants with acute ankle sprain.

primaryOutcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Pain on Movement (POM) on Day 5 of Treatment as Assessed by a 100 Millimeter (mm) Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
